Extension.

 

Any idea of the vessel limits/requirements, other than drone? (ie, weight, funds, etc)

It will be quite a bit higher, funds wise.  Not positive on the specifics yet, but I am planning a chain of target areas with 1 to 3 ground targets each.  There may be SAM sites in the mix with occasional defensive fighters as well. I am hoping that I can space them so that the AI is smart enough to go from one to the next.

Trench Run?

 

Here's the idea: set up a series of gates which you have to fly through, but the catch is each gate has a pair of fixed turrets or missile rails armed with heatseekers, one at the base of each post aiming into the approach. At the far end of the gate run, there's a 2m target which you basically have to obliterate with one pass. While at the same time trying not to get shot down by defending drones as well as the surface fixed guns and a tracking turret behind the target (thinking a howitzer or something equally slow-firing, just to give the challenger a chance).

30 minutes ago, SasquatchM said:

I set up some test SAM sites to build a run, but the intercept missiles, even one at a time, are just too deadly.  I am trying to tweak the settings a bit to try to balance it out.

what's your RADAR setup? Usually RADAR guided SAM (AIM120) sites have one RADAR vehicle among several spaced launchers. So you'd have your RADAR truck (with some sort of CIWS (AIM9?)) on a hilltop and the launchers in a ravine or side of the hill under concealment

AIM 120 AMRAAM = Advanced Medium Range Air to Air Missile (Radar guided)

AIM 9 Sidewinder = Advanced Short Range Air to Air Missile (Heat seeking)

@ihtoit - You will be hard pressed to find any nation in the world launching these types of ordinance from the ground outside of for testing purposes.

EDIT ----- There are 2 countries who use an AIM 120 SAM system, one being the US and the other being Norway. In the case of the US this system is generally used only in mountainous terrain where APAR can be fooled by the target flying low through mountains.

APAR = Advanced Phased Array Radar
